Name: Golden Statuette of Amenhotep the Third
Description: As he was possibly the grandfather of King Tutankhamun, this statuette of Amenhotep the Third was found in the tomb of Tutankhamun. Amenhotep the Third is portrayed here in a squatting position, wearing the Blue Crown and carrying the scepter and flail. He wears a real gold necklace with beads that are probably glass. The statuette was suspended by a looped gold chain to be used as a pendant.
